description: The Institute of Cultural Affairs (ICA) Nepal, established in March 1998 in Kathmandu, Nepal, is an autonomous, non-governmental organization registered with the government of Nepal and the Social Welfare Council. It focuses on research, training, facilitation, and community development activities. ICA Nepal is part of a global network of ICAs working in 30 developing countries. The organization is dedicated to building people's capacities and promoting social innovation through participation and community building. ICA Nepal aims to enlarge opportunities for disadvantaged communities and ordinary people in Nepal by enhancing individual capacities through training, facilitation, and human development activities.

The Institute of Cultural Affairs (ICA) Nepal, established in March 1998 in Kathmandu, Nepal, is an autonomous, non-governmental organization registered with the government of Nepal and the Social Welfare Council. It focuses on research, training, facilitation, and community development activities. ICA Nepal is part of a network of autonomous ICAs worldwide working in 30 developing countries. The organization is dedicated to building people's capacities and promoting social innovation by enhancing participation and community building.

The Institute of Cultural Affairs-Nepal was established in March 1998 in Kathmandu, Nepal as an autonomous, non-governmental organization registered with the government of Nepal and Social Welfare council research, Training, facilitation and community development activities. ICA's activities are based on participation. The organization is dedicated to building people's capacities whether they are rural village inhabitants or business executive in public training courses.

The Institute of Cultural Affairs-Nepal (ICA-N) was established in March 1998 in Kathmandu, Nepal as an autonomous, non-governmental organization registered with the government of Nepal and Social Welfare council research, Training, facilitation and community development activities. ICA's activities are based on participation. The organization is dedicated to building people's capacities whether they are rural village inhabitants or business executive in public training courses.

The Institute of Cultural Affairs- Nepal was established in March 1998 in Kathmandu, Nepal as an autonomous, non-governmental organization registered with the government of Nepal and Social Welfare council research, Training, facilitation and community development activities. ICA's activities are based on participation. The organization is dedicated to building people's capacities whether they are rural village inhabitants or business executive in public training courses.
